maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new WMI Event Subscription (Filter, Consumer, Binding) on a local or remote hosts.

The Add-Subscription cmdlet creates a new WMI Event Subscription, and sets it parameters. The cmdlet makes three seperate WMI objects, an __EventFilter, a Consumer (CommandLineEventConsumer or LogFileEventConsumer), and a __FilterToConsumerBinding.
Creates a New WMI Event Subscriptions running on the specified computers. The default is the local computer.
Type the NetBIOS name, and IP address, or a fully qulaified domain name of one or more computers.

This parameter does not rely on Windows PowerShell remoting. You can use the ComputerName parameter of Get-Subscription as long as the remote computer has its RPC Server running. Additionally, PowerShell must be run with appropriate credentials for the remote endpoint.
Specifies the Name of the Subscription (WMI Event Subscription). The same name will be used for the Filter, Consumer, and Binding.
Type is used to specify what type of EventConsumer to use. The options are the CommandLineEventConsumer and LogFileEventConsumer. The default is CommandLineEventConsumer.
Provides the path location of the file the subscription will output to for the LogFileEventConsumer.
A remote file path can be specified using the Universal Naming Convention Path (e.g. \\computer\C$\output.txt).
If a remote file path is used, the location must be writable by the Domain Computers group (the host's Computer Account).
Provides the name of the output file for the LogFileEventConsumer.
Default file name is target hostname.
The WMI Query Language Query that will be used by the __EventFilter.
Sets the text to output for the LogFileEventConsumer
Allows the cmdlet to overwrite a Subscription that already exists.
Creates a New WMI Event Subscriptions running on the specified computers. The default is the local computer.
Type the NetBIOS name, and IP address, or a fully qulaified domain name of one or more computers.

This parameter does not rely on Windows PowerShell remoting. You can use the ComputerName parameter of Get-Subscription as long as the remote computer has its RPC Server running. Additionally, PowerShell must be run with appropriate credentials for the remote endpoint.
Type is used to specify what type of EventConsumer to use. The options are the CommandLineEventConsumer and LogFileEventConsumer. The default is CommandLineEventConsumer.
Specifies the Name of the Subscription (WMI Event Subscription). The same name will be used for the Filter, Consumer, and Binding.
Allows the cmdlet to overwrite a Subscription that already exists.
The WMI Query Language Query that will be used by the __EventFilter.
Provides the path location of the file the subscription will output to for the LogFileEventConsumer.
A remote file path can be specified using the Universal Naming Convention Path (e.g. \\computer\C$\output.txt).
If a remote file path is used, the location must be writable by the Domain Computers group (the host's Computer Account).
Provides the name of the output file for the LogFileEventConsumer.
Default file name is target hostname.
Sets the text to output for the LogFileEventConsumer
This cmdlet does not accept an input object.
This cmdlet generates the Uproot.Subscription object that is associated with the Permanent WMI Event Subscription that was added.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $ComputerName = 'localhost' $FileName = 'C:\Users\Uproot\Desktop\driver.txt' $Name = 'DRIVER_CREATION' $Query = "SELECT * FROM __InstanceCreationEvent WITHIN 1 WHERE TargetInstance ISA 'Win32_SystemDriver'" $Text = "%TargetInstance.SystemName%|'DRIVER_CREATION'|%TIME_CREATED%|%TargetInstance.Name%|%TargetInstance.PathName%|%TargetInstance.Caption%|%TargetInstance.Started%|%TargetInstance.StartMode%|%TargetInstance.StartName%|%TargetInstance.ServiceType%" Add-Subscription -ComputerName $ComputerName -Name $Name -Query $Query -FileName $FileName -Text $Text -Type "LogFile" -Force

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a new Subscription.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the WMI Event Subscription Subscriptions that are running on the local or remote computer.
The Get-Subscription cmdlet gets WMI Event Subscriptions on a local or remote computer.
Without parameters, Get-Subscription gets all of the WMI Event Subscriptions on the local computer. You can also specify a particular subscription by subscription name.

When a specific name is used, Get-Subscription will return an array of the __Filter, CommandLineEventConsumer, and __FilterToConsumerBinding corresponding with the given name. When no name is specified, the Get-Subscription cmdlet will return all __FilterToConsumerBinding Objects.
Gets the WMI Event Subscriptions running on the specified computers. The default is the local computer.
Type the NetBIOS name, and IP address, or a fully qulaified domain name of one or more computers.

This parameter does not rely on Windows PowerShell remoting. You can use the ComputerName parameter of Get-Subscription as long as the remote computer has its RPC Server running. Additionally, PowerShell must be run with appropriate credentials for the remote endpoint.
Gets the WMI Event Subscriptions running on the specified computers. The default is the local computer.
Type the NetBIOS name, and IP address, or a fully qulaified domain name of one or more computers.

This parameter does not rely on Windows PowerShell remoting. You can use the ComputerName parameter of Get-Subscription as long as the remote computer has its RPC Server running. Additionally, PowerShell must be run with appropriate credentials for the remote endpoint.
Specifies the Name of the intended Uproot Subscription (WMI Event Subscription).
Gets the WMI Event Subscriptions running on the specified computers. The default is the local computer.
Type the NetBIOS name, and IP address, or a fully qulaified domain name of one or more computers.

This parameter does not rely on Windows PowerShell remoting. You can use the ComputerName parameter of Get-Subscription as long as the remote computer has its RPC Server running. Additionally, PowerShell must be run with appropriate credentials for the remote endpoint.
Specifies the Name of the intended Uproot Subscription (WMI Event Subscription).
This cmdlet accepts one or more string(s) representing a computer hostname (based on the property name).
This cmdlet generates the Subscription Objects that are associated with the Uproot WMI Event Subscription Objects.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-Subscription
ComputerName Name ConsumerType ------------ ---- ------------ WIN-OL5AKAF1OUJ SERVICE_DELETION LogFileEventConsumer WIN-OL5AKAF1OUJ DRIVER_DELETION LogFileEventConsumer WIN-OL5AKAF1OUJ DRIVER_CREATION LogFileEventConsumer

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command returns all the Uproot.Subscription objects registered on the local system.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-Subscription -Name "SERVICE_DELETION"
ComputerName Name ConsumerType ------------ ---- ------------ WIN-OL5AKAF1OUJ SERVICE_DELETION LogFileEventConsumer

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command returns the Uproot.Subscription object that is identified by the specified Name.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes specified WMI Event Subscription Subscriptions that are running on the local or remote computer.
The Remove-Subscription cmdlet deletes WMI Event Subscription. Subscriptions can be passed via the pipeline from Get-Subscription, or their name and type can be specified as arguments.
Remove-Subscription removes the Filter, Consumer, and Binding for each Subscription.
An object created by Get-Subscription that can be passed via the pipeline to Remove-Subscription for deletion.
Removes WMI Event Subscriptions running on the specified computers. The default is the local computer.
Type the NetBIOS name, and IP address, or a fully qulaified domain name of one or more computers.

This parameter does not rely on Windows PowerShell remoting. You can use the ComputerName parameter of Get-Subscription as long as the remote computer has its RPC Server running. Additionally, PowerShell must be run with appropriate credentials for the remote endpoint.
Contains the name of the Subscription that should be removed.
If an object is received via the pipeline, the Name parameter is not used.
An object created by Get-Subscription that can be passed via the pipeline to Remove-Subscription for deletion.
Removes WMI Event Subscriptions running on the specified computers. The default is the local computer.
Type the NetBIOS name, and IP address, or a fully qulaified domain name of one or more computers.

This parameter does not rely on Windows PowerShell remoting. You can use the ComputerName parameter of Get-Subscription as long as the remote computer has its RPC Server running. Additionally, PowerShell must be run with appropriate credentials for the remote endpoint.
Contains the name of the Subscription that should be removed.
If an object is received via the pipeline, the Name parameter is not used.
This cmdlet accepts one or more Uproot.Subscription objects as input that populates the InputObject parameter.
This cmdlet does not generate any output.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes all of the Subscriptions on the local machine.
The output of the Get-Subscription cmdlet is piped to the Remove-Subscription cmdlet. The output is a set of Uproot.Subscription objects.
